translated: Points of Controversy
The Fifty on Refutation🔽16. The section on exertion
Exertion
Does one exert oneself in another’s consciousness?
Yes.

original: Paro parassa cittaṁ “mā rajji”, “mā dussi”, “mā muyhi”, “mā kilissī”ti paggaṇhātīti?
analyzed: parassa parassa cittam mā rajji mā dussi mā muyhi mā kilissi iti paggaṇhāti iti
translated: Does one exert oneself in another’s consciousness, thinking: ‘Don’t be greedy, don’t be greedy’, ‘Don’t be hateful, don’t be hateful’, ‘Don’t be deluded, don’t be deluded’, ‘Don’t be agitated, don’t be agitated’?
You shouldn’t say that.
Does one exert oneself in another’s consciousness?
Yes.

analyzed: paraḥ parassa alobham kusala mūlam janeti
translated: Does one generate another’s non-greed, the wholesome root …

original: adosaṁ kusalamūlaṁ janeti …🔽amohaṁ kusalamūlaṁ janeti …🔽saddhaṁ janeti …🔽vīriyaṁ janeti …🔽satiṁ janeti …
analyzed: a dosam kusala mūlam jana iti  amoham kusala mūlam jana iti  sad ham jana iti  vīriyam jana iti  satim jana iti
translated: non-hate, the wholesome root …🔽non-delusion, the wholesome root …🔽faith …🔽energy …🔽mindfulness …
concentration …
wisdom?
You shouldn’t say that.
Does one exert oneself in another’s consciousness?
Yes.

original: Paro parassa uppanno phasso “mā nirujjhī”ti paggaṇhātīti?
analyzed: paraḥ parassa uppannaḥ phassaḥ mā nirujjhi iti paggaṇhāti iti
translated: Does one exert oneself in another’s arisen contact, thinking: ‘Don’t cease, don’t cease’?
You shouldn’t say that.
Does one exert oneself in another’s arisen feeling …🔽arisen perception …🔽arisen volition …🔽arisen consciousness …🔽arisen contact …🔽arisen feeling …🔽arisen perception …🔽arisen volition …

analyzed: uppannā paññā mā nirujjhi iti paggaṇhāti iti
translated: arisen consciousness, thinking: ‘Don’t cease, don’t cease’?
You shouldn’t say that.
Does one person take hold of the mind of another?
“Yes.”

original: Paro parassa atthāya rāgaṁ pajahati …🔽dosaṁ pajahati …
analyzed: paraḥ parassa atthāya rāgam pajahati  dosam pajahati
translated: “Does one person abandon for another greed …🔽hatred …
delusion …
non-contentment?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“Does one person take hold of the mind of another?
“Yes.”
“Does one person develop for another the path …
the foundations of mindfulness …
the factors for awakening?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …
“Does one person take hold of the mind of another?
“Yes.”

analyzed: paraḥ parassa atthāya dukkham parijānāti pe
translated: “Does one person understand for another suffering …
develop the path?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …
“Does one person take hold of the mind of another?
“Yes.”

original: Añño aññassa kārako, paraṅkataṁ sukhaṁ dukkhaṁ añño karoti añño paṭisaṁvedetīti?
analyzed: aññaḥ aññassa kārako paraṅkatam sukham dukkham aññaḥ karoti aññaḥ paṭisavedeti iti
translated: “Is one person the doer, another the enjoyer? Does one person make the choice, another experience the result?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“Does one person take hold of the mind of another?
“Yes.”
Has it not been said by the Blessed One:🔽“Evil is done by oneself,
and suffering is experienced by oneself.
One person can’t purify another.”
Is there such a discourse?
Yes.
Then you shouldn’t say that,
“One person can know the mind of another.”
You shouldn’t say that,
“One person can know the mind of another.”
Yes.

analyzed: nanu atthi balappattā atthi vasībhūtā ati
translated: But aren’t there those who have attained psychic power and those who have control over their minds?
Yes.

original: Hañci atthi balappattā, atthi vasībhūtā, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci atthi balappattā atthi vasībhūtā tena vata re vattabbe
translated: Well then, since there are those who have attained psychic power and those who have control over their minds, you should say that,
“One person can know the mind of another.”
The discussion of knowing the minds of others is finished.
